studyID: The stable, unique identifier for a study that never changes, even if other study metadata changes (like the study name, short name, owner, or project). Example: STUDY_SCA
optional persistent row identifier: Use studyID as the anchor, plus a persistent row identifier to identify a specific file/version, etc.
optional persistent row identifier - va: Enter a unique identifier for the selection made.
optional appliesTo: Indicates the level of entity to which a metadata value applies (e.g., individual participant or population summary).
optional aggregationLevel: Specifies whether a metadata value represents individual-level data or an aggregate summary
optional populationScope: Identifies the population described by the metadata (e.g., study-wide, cohort, or study arm).
deviceType: The type of digital device used for data collection, applicable only when data are collected digitally.
softwarePlatform: The software environment or application used to deliver, collect, or manage digitally collected data.
inputMethod: The primary method by which participant input or data capture occurs during digital data collection.
administrationMode: The manner in which a digital assessment or data collection activity is administered to participants.
manufacturerModel: Device make/model. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
operatingSystem: OS and version. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
appPlatform: App or platform used. Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
sensors: Sensors enabled (GPS, accelerometer, etc.). Valid values: free text OR Multiple, Varies, Unknown.
measuredConstruct: A conceptual domain or construct that a study collected data on (e.g., depression, working memory, physical activity).
constructDescription: One-sentence description of how the construct was operationalized in the study.
measureType: The general type of measure used to assess a construct.
isValidatedMeasure: Indicates whether a measure or instrument used to assess a construct has been previously validated.
measureDescription: A brief description of how a measure was administered and what it was designed to assess.
if not provided as a row identifier ins: a stable identifier used to reference a specific instrument, measure, or assessment used in a study (e.g., a validated questionnaire, cognitive task, interview protocol, or sensor-based assessment).
instrumentName: Name of the instrument or scale used (e.g., PHQ-9, NIH Toolbox).
instrumentCitation: The primary citation(s) describing the instrument/task implementation used in the study (e.g., published paper, manual, DOI).
instrumentVersion: Version identifier for the instrument implementation used (e.g., vendor version, protocol revision, “v2”, “2016 revision”).
stimulusResponseMode: How participants interacted with the instrument during administration.
administrationInstructions: The instructions provided to participants describing exactly how to perform the instrument/task (verbatim or summarized).
administrationProcedure: The source of the implementation (e.g., NIH Toolbox, PEBL, PsychoPy script, custom app).
protocolDescription: The synID of the wiki that contains the protocol, study design and goals
protocolURL: Link to the protocol, manual, script, or documentation describing the instrument implementation.
